p: A comparison of the effects of the studied plant extracts on acetic acid-induced writhing in mice was also done in this study ( Figure 4). The results revealed that, at all the studied dose levels, the aqueous stem bark extract of P. thonningii conferred significantly higher percentage inhibition (less writhing frequency) of acetic acid-induced writhing compared to its methanolic counterpart at the same dose levels ( p < 0.05; Figure 4).
